SENT.plain: Blood cysts within the heart are rare findings in adults
We describe a case of a woman with a history of orthotopic liver transplantation who presented for an echocardiogram to evaluate a potential source of cerebrovascular embolism
A cystic mass attached to the submitral valve apparatus was identified by transthoracic and confirmed by transesophageal echocardiography
Surgical exploration and pathologic examination confirmed the mass to be a blood cyst attached to the chordal apparatus of the posterior papillary muscle
This case report highlights the use of echocardiography in diagnosing intracardiac blood cysts
